title: Georgia House - Day 19 (2026-02-22)
summary:
Overview:
The Georgia House session on 2026-02-22 included discussion of several bills, notable speeches, and a focus on the role of chaplains in supporting law enforcement and public servants.

Key Actions:
**HB 1096**: Bill referred to committee
**HB 1146**: Bill referred to committee
**HB 826**: Bill referred to committee

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
No new bills were introduced.

Notable Moments:
- Representative Katie Dempsey and Representative Eddie Lommons recognized Chaplain David Thornton for his decades of service as a chaplain supporting law enforcement and first responders.
- Chaplain Thornton gave an inspirational speech on the role of chaplains as "peacemakers" and the importance of prayer for lawmakers, law enforcement, and the nation.

Votes:
No recorded votes.

Attendance:
Quorum present.

Adjournment:
The House adjourned. The next session is scheduled for 2026-02-23.
